title: Why do many Scandinavians have blonde hair and blue eyes? What percentage of the population are they? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, due to the fact that in northern climates, the need for Vitamin D is better acquired by people who have lighter pigmentation. So over time, humans who were lighter-pigmented survived longer than those who were darker in the north. This also means their genes prevailed over dark ones, this is why many ethnic Scandinavians are blonde-haired or light-pigmented. Though they are all not uniformly blonde there are variations within various parts. Scandinavia as a whole is the most fairest-haired regions of Europe and the world .% of fair hairNorway = (usually) 75%+, especially in Central Norway, though some regions to southwest and the very north have a range of 65-74%.
